introduction.p: Express the following statements as differential equations. In each case, you will need to introduce notation to describe the important quantities in the statement so be sure to clearly state what your notation means.

statement.p: The population of a town grows continuously at an annual rate of 1.25%.

hint.p: Small hints for each of the prompts above.

answer.p:
Let P be the population t the time in years;
\frac{dP}{dt} = 0.0125P.

solution.p:
Let P be the population of the town and let t be the time in years. The population of the town grows continuously at an annual rate of 1.25\% means that
\frac{dP}{dt} = 0.0125P .

statement.p: A radioactive sample loses mass at a rate of 5.6% of its mass every day.

answer.p:
Let m be the mass t the time in days;
\frac{dm}{dt} = -0.056m.

solution.p:
Let m be the mass of a radioactive sample and let t be the time in days. The sample loses 5.6% f its mass every day means that
\frac{dm}{dt} = -0.056m .

statement.p: You have a bank account that continuously earns 4% interest every year. At the same time, you withdraw money continually from the account at the rate of $1000 per year.

answer.p:
Let B be the balance t be time in years;
\frac{dB}{dt} = 0.04B - 1000.

solution.p:
Let B be the balance (in dollars) in the account and let t be the time in years. The money in the account continuously earns 4% interest every year and $1000 is withdrawn every year means that
\frac{dB}{dt} = 0.04B - 1000 .

statement.p: A cup of hot chocolate is sitting in a 70^\circ room. The temperature of the hot chocolate cools continuously by 10% of the difference between the hot chocolate's temperature and the room temperature every minute.

answer.p:
Let t be time in minutes H the temperature of the hot chocolate;
\frac{dH}{dt} = -0.1(H - 70).

solution.p:
The temperature of a room is 70^\circ. Let t be time in minutes. The temperature H of a cup of hot chocolate cools continuosly by 10% of the difference between the hot chocolate's temperature and the room temperature every minute means that
\frac{dH}{dt} = -0.1(H - 70) .

statement.p: A can of cold soda is sitting in a 70^\circ room. The temperature of the soda warms continuously at the rate of 10% of the difference between the soda's temperature and the room's temperature every minute.

solution.p:
The temperature of a room is 70^\circ. Let t be time in minutes. The temperature H of a can of soda warms continuosly by 10% of the difference between the soda's temperature and the room temperature every minute means that
\frac{dH}{dt} = 0.1(70 - H) = -0.1(H - 70) .
